prompt: If region x is SE of region y and region y is SE of region z, then which could be the possible relations between region x and region z?
answer:
If region x is SE of region y and region y is SE of region z, then the only possible relation between region x and region z is SE.

To verify this:

When x is SE of y:
- supx(y) ≤ infx(x) (x is entirely to the east of y)
- supy(x) ≤ infy(y) (x is entirely to the south of y)

When y is SE of z:
- supx(z) ≤ infx(y) (y is entirely to the east of z)
- supy(y) ≤ infy(z) (y is entirely to the south of z)

By transitivity:
- supx(z) ≤ infx(y) ≤ supx(y) ≤ infx(x), therefore supx(z) ≤ infx(x)
- supy(x) ≤ infy(y) ≤ supy(y) ≤ infy(z), therefore supy(x) ≤ infy(z)

These two conditions together satisfy exactly the definition of SE relation between x and z.

SE
